description.en:
The course discusses in detail the meaning of intellectual property, the problems related to its creation, protection and commercialization. The course consists of the following main stages:
1.	Meaning of intellectual property
2.	Industrial property and the ownership rights
3.	Author's rights
4.	Legislative framework of the protection of intellectual property
5.	Patent search, the principles of writing patent proposals
6.	Market search
7.	The methods of IP commercialization: licensing, creation of spin-offs
description.et:
Kursus lahkab põhjalikult intellektuaalomandi olemust, selle loomise, kaitse ja kommertsialiseerimisega seotud probleemistikku. Kursus koosneb järgmistest põhiosadest:
1.	Intellektuaalomandi olemus
2.	Tööstusomand ja selle varaliste õiguste kuuluvus 
3.	Autoriõigused
4.	Intellektuaalomandi kaitse seadusandlik raamistik
5.	Patendiuuringud, patenditaotluste kirjutamise printsiibid
6.	Turu-uuringud
7.	Intellektuaalomandi kommertsialiseerimise meetodid: litsentseerimine, spin-off firmade loomine

objectives.en: To educate PhD students about the importance of intellectual property, the problems and opportunities related to IP protection and commercialization
objectives.et: Viia doktorandid kurssi intellektuaalomandi tähtsusega ning selle kaitse ja kommertsialiseerimisega seotud probleemistiku ja võimalustega

learning_outcomes.en: 1. To obtain knowledge about the meaning of intellectual property, industial property and author's rights. 2. To get information about regulations of IP management. 3. To understand the need to carry out patent and market searches.
learning_outcomes.et: 1. Arusaama teke intellektuaalomandi olemusest, tööstusomandist ja autoriõigusest. 2. Teadmiste omandamine intellektuaalomandi käitlemist reguleerivatest õigusaktidest. 3. Arusaam vajadusest läbi viia patendi- ja turu-uuringuid.

grade_evaluation.et:
The goal of this Intellectual Property (IP) course is to provide you with elementary skills needed to identify, evaluate and protect IP.
 
As a creator or holder of the IP rights, it is not only a privilege but also a responsibility to make the most out of those rights. It's your opportunity to facilitate positive change (including wealth) with your knowledge in you, your family, institution and society!
 
By the end of this course you will have the elementary skills and knowledge to conduct an IP audit for yourself and your lab. To conclude this course, you will present a written summary of the audit.
